concept.title: Command foundation
concept.shortdesc: One or more words at the command prompt.

section.p: The command foundation is a minimum of one word at the CLI prompt that combines at least one attribute, and resolves to a command itself, whether or not there are more optional attributes and/or parameters available: cli> show alarms

section.title: Syntax
section.p: The syntax section lists all the variations of the command foundation with available attributes and parameters, as in: show alarms active severity all show alarms active severity critical show alarms active severity major show alarms active severity minor show alarms active severity warning

section.title: Attributes
section.p: Attributes that concatenate with the command foundation are listed in a table.

section.title: Sub-attributes
section.p: Sub-attributes are concatenated with attributes and listed in a table.

section.title: Parameters
section.p: Parameters that concatenate with attributes, sub-attributes, and other parameters are listed in a table.

section.title: Output
section.p: Lists and defines the output columns provided by the command foundation.

section.title: Reference
section.p: Provides references for terminology expressed in command output. Usually an RFC, internal MIB, or industry standard specifications, as in http://www.acpi.info/spec10b.htm .
